1.verse: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.

2.verse: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.

3.verse: Trust in the LORD, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.

4.verse: Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.

5.verse: Commit thy way unto the LORD; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.

6.verse: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

7.verse: Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

8.verse: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.

9.verse: For evildoers shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the LORD, they shall inherit the earth.

10.verse: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.

11.verse: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

12.verse: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

13.verse: The Lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming.

14.verse: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.

15.verse: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.

16.verse: A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.

17.verse: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the LORD upholdeth the righteous.

18.verse: The LORD knoweth the days of the upright: and their inheritance shall be for ever.

19.verse: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time: and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

20.verse: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.

21.verse: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.

22.verse: For such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be cut off.

23.verse: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD: and he delighteth in his way.

24.verse: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the LORD upholdeth him with his hand.

25.verse: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.

26.verse: He is ever merciful, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.

27.verse: Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.

28.verse: For the LORD loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his saints; they are preserved for ever: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.

29.verse: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.

30.verse: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.

31.verse: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.

32.verse: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.

33.verse: The LORD will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.

34.verse: Wait on the LORD, and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.

35.verse: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.

36.verse: Yet he passed away, and, lo, he was not: yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.

37.verse: Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of that man is peace.

38.verse: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together: the end of the wicked shall be cut off.

39.verse: But the salvation of the righteous is of the LORD: he is their strength in the time of trouble.

40.verse: And the LORD shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they trust in him.
